metadata.title: CVE-2021-29922 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
library/std/src/net/parser.rs in Rust before 1.53.0 does not properlyconsider extraneous zero characters at the beginning of an IP addressstring, which (in some situations) allows attackers to bypass accesscontrol that is based on IP addresses, because of unexpected octalinterpretation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libstd-rust-1.53 - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rust-all - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rust-clippy - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rust-gdb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rust-lldb - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rust-src - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rustc - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
rustfmt - 1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: rustc package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.53.0+dfsg1+llvm-4ubuntu1').
